losing weight nicely. Exercising and eating right is not even something I 
have to force myself to do anymore, it's just a normal thing for me and I 
love that I've gotten to that point.﻿

comments.author: Jacob Zalk

comments.text:
All of this video is so wrong. I'm someone who lost 30 pounds in one summer 
and I can say everything in the video IS WRONG.
1.It's all about calories- its not, its about what kinds of foods you eat. 
Eating a simple carb would make you gain more weight due to glycemic index 
than a complex carb with the same calorie amount.
2. Breakfast is very important. Skipping breakfast slows your metabolism in 
the morning and leads to bad habits. 
3. Eating a big dinner is not good. Your putting food in your body before 
you go to sleep and stop digestion.

My guide to losing weight:
-drink plenty of water
-eat lots of fruits and vegetables
-stop eating fried foods
-stop eating simple carbs and reduce complex carb amount
-drink less dairy

I recommend that if your an athlete and/or still a teenager that you not 
cut out carbs and dairy.﻿
comments.author: marc dexar-ho

comments.text:
+marc dexar-ho Hahaha okay buddy.
1. BULLSHIT! The laws of physics disagree with you. Just look at stuff like 
this: http://www.20potatoesaday.com/ . Sure, eating 20 potatoes is neither 
varied nor balanced, but all he did was eat enough to maintain his weight 
or created a calorie deficit and lost weight. He was eating ~500g of carbs 
a day and lost 20lbs and majorly reduced his cholesterol and blood 
pressure. And okay, if you wanna talk about the difference between complex 
+ simple carbs, look at the guy who lost 56lbs eating only McDonald's 
(while sticking to a calorie amount of 2000 with light walking). Calorie 
deficit = weight loss. NO EXCEPTIONS. 


2. 
http://www.forbes.com/sites/alicegwalton/2014/06/05/skipping-breakfast-may-not-be-so-bad-for-weight-loss-study-finds/ 
A study of 300 overweight and obese patients shows that eating breakfast 
has almost no affect on the amount of weight you lose.


3. There is ZERO evidence that shows that eating right before bed or large 
amounts late at night will cause weight gain. If you OVEREAT AT ANY TIME 
you will gain weight. It all comes back to calories in vs. calories out. If 
you eat a 1000 cal meal in the morning or at midnight there will be no 
difference in how it affects your body.
comments.author: dapperboots

comments.text:
That's a lie for breakfast. You have to eat a small portion of something 
like a small bowl or cereal or toast. Your brain's neurons will eat itself 
from lack of food (If you think this is crazy look it up, enough said). 
Humans suppose to actually eat six times a day but no more of two hand 
fulls, which are small portions. They're correct about everything else.﻿

comments.text:
To get your metabolism rolling in the AM, drinking a glass of water or 
coffee (black) will do just fine. You don't need to stuff your face! 
Trainers will tell you that you need to cut out 500 calories a day to lose 
a pound a week. You can do this by cutting the amount you eat and increase 
the amount you burn. Its that simple. No tricks, no pills. It took more 
than a day to put it on and it takes more than a day to take if off.﻿
comments.author: Elizabeth Ward

comments.text:
Wait a second...you CANNOT gain fat cells. The number of fat cells you have 
stays the same from the age of 2. They do expand and how much they expand 
is actually not known because you skin will burst first before the fat 
cells will. Is it true that obese children under 2 years will have more fat 
cells than a regular person and will have a harder time losing weigh later 
in life. So you NEVER gain fat cells, they just expand. They only way to 
lose fat cells? Liposuction. Also, having breakfast starts off you 
metabolism. Not eating will cause you body to go in 'distress' and whatever 
you eat will be immediately stored by your body because it fears it will go 
hungry again. See your body as a stove that you have to give enough wood to 
keep it burning and at regular times. If you don't give it enough wood, it 
will not really burn anymore... :)﻿

comments.author: Keegan Jay

comments.text:
+Always watchin' o_o Breakfast has nothing to do with metabolism. Your 
metabolism never stops working, and it is not 'boosted' by anything. It's 
exactly like Buzzfeed said. Meal timing has nothing to do with metabolism. 
Eat breakfast if not eating it makes you more hungry and makes you eat 
more. If you don't want to eat it then that's also perfectly fine, no harm 
done. I've lost 58lbs in less than a year and I haven't eaten breakfast for 
a long time. Eating breakfast makes me feel far more hungry and I feel sick 
in the mornings if I eat it. It means I have more calories left for lunch 
and therefore I'm less likely to snack between lunch and dinner. It's down 
to personal preference.
comments.author: Katie S

comments.text:
+taylor reid I agree. Breakfast boosts your metabolism for the whole day. 
So even if your appetite is "bigger" like buzzfeed claims, if you can 
restrain yourself from overeating, you actually lose weight much faster.

comments.text:
no fruit contains 400 calories, If i eat a lot fruit to add up to 400 then 
that means I'll be more full and I won't have to go binge eat a 900 calorie 
meal for dinner and so I stay within my calorie cap. But if I eat a 300 
calorie burger (which is a pretty light burger if its 300 calories), I 
won't be that full cause it's one burger and so I might resort to eating 
too much for dinner and could go over the calorie cap and so gain weight. 
It's not about eating what has less calories - its about what will keep you 
within your calories for the day. Different foods have different effects - 
they either make you stay within your calorie cap or above it. You choose 
the ones that keep you below such as fruit.
comments.author: UmgKh

comments.text:
'Calories' is a pretty un-biological term. It actually does matter where 
your calories come from, though you do need a range of fats, cabs, and 
protein. A 500 calorie meal where 400 calories come from protein and 100 
calories comes from carbs will be better for you than a 400 calorie meal 
that is 350 calories of fat and 50 calories of protein. ﻿

comments.text:
Inaccurate.
It doesn't matter how many calories, what matter is what you're eating and 
what's in it. McDolnalds could have less calories in it than it does now, 
but that doesn't matter because of what's in the food.
Also to lose weight you shouldn't have 3 big meals a day, binging and then 
suddenly eating a lot will make you gain more. You should balance it out. 
5-6 SMALL meals a day.
You're right about the exercise and diet though. Food is what mostly
